channel.title: I have a problem with ALL [PI] sources
channel.description:
I have a little problem. With every (and i mean EVERY) [PI] source that I use, I always have the same problem. Okay, here it is: I can put the server on, other people can play on it..But when i try to log in, i log in for about 2 seconds, dc, and it automatically logs me back in. I cannot walk within those 2 seconds, i cannot do anything within those 2 seconds. also, when i log in, it takes a long time to load the game part. it's just black. the frame is visible, and is able to be moved, but i have no idea why it does nto work. I've had my other friends host the exact same server for me, i just gave them the files, and i could log in perfectly. and so could my friend that was hosting it. I would very, VERY much appreciate it if some one could help me on this.
My computer Stats: Windows 7 2ghz proc. 2gig RAM ???[Need anything more and I'll be happy to tell]???

item.title: I have a problem with ALL [PI] sources
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

try deleting your character file you could have some null data in there

Read full topic

item.source: I have a problem with ALL [PI] sources

item.title: I have a problem with ALL [PI] sources
item.dc:creator: @oxygen1 oxygen-_
item.description:
@oxygen1 wrote:

Lol. Here’s the answer to this.:

If you host a server, you have to make 2 separate clients. the player client(containing the no-ip) and the owner client(containing the connection ip as 127.0.0.1)

Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: I have a problem with ALL [PI] sources
item.dc:creator: @oxygen1 oxygen-_
item.description:
@oxygen1 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:10, topic:417379”]You may need to

Use 64 bit Java on a 64 bit OS (if you have one)
Decrease Java heap size
Decrease Java thread stack sizes[/quote]

Yes, i have 64 bit computer, but also have 64 bit java… both jdk 64bit and regular java 64bit…and what do you mean by decrease java heap size or decrease java thread stack sizes

Read full topic

doesnt mean its not your comp when someone else host’s it because when your hosting your serv your comp cpu usage goes up

item.title: I have a problem with ALL [PI] sources
item.dc:creator: @stnbarton12 stnbarton12
item.description:
@stnbarton12 wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Graphics processing unit

A graphics processing unit (GPU) is a specialized electronic circuit designed to rapidly manipulate and alter memory to accelerate the creation of images in a frame buffer intended for output to a display device. GPUs are used in embedded systems, mobile phones, personal computers, workstations, and game consoles. Modern GPUs are very efficient at manipulating computer graphics and image processing, and their highly parallel structure makes them more efficient than general-purpose CPUs for algori...
